result.execSummary:
All charges against Gary B. Campbell Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary B. Campbell Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary B. Campbell Jr

records.addlTxt:
11:41 AM Defendant Gary B. Campbell Jr in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Gary B. Campbell Jr.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech moves to dismiss the case and states the reason.  Atty Gumz has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Case dismissed per request of the State.
Released from bond.

1:20 PM Defendant Gary B. Campbell Jr appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Gary B. Campbell Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the matter is not resolved; requests a Preliminary Hearing be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary B. Campbell Jr appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Gary B. Campbell Jr. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Gumz states that the Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing and requests a status be set.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:32 PM Defendant Gary B. Campbell Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint,  Court confirms address.  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
